intro: Dracaena serrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dracaena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the stems. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions. Dracaena serrulata prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
